q:
Mike was working on Selenium WebDriver using Java. During a run session in his testing environment, he expected some unexpected events and errors. To solve this issue he wanted to use the Recovery Scenarios so that he can instruct UFT to recover. So to use the Recovery Scenarios which of the following Java code snippets should Mike use so that he can resolve his issue?

Java Code Snippets

  1. try {
     driver.get("www.hackerearth.com");
}catch(Exception e){
     System.out.println(e.getMessage());
}

     

  2. try {
     driver.get("www.hackerearth.com");
}catch(Exception e){
     System.out.println(driver.getMessage());
}

     

  3. driver.get("www.hackerearth.com");
System.out.println(getMessage());

     

  4. driver.get("www.hackerearth.com");
System.out.println(driver.getMessage());

Mary was working on Selenium WebDriver using Java. mary wrote the following Java code to click on an element. 

Java Code

driver.findElement(By.id("Id Value")).click();

But Mary was unable to achieve this task due to some issue. She found out and wanted to solve this using the JavaScriptExecutor interface. But Mary don't know how to execute it. In this scenario if you are required to help Mary then which of the following Java code snippets would you suggest Mary?

 

Note : Consider Mary has imported the following package

import org.openqa.selenium.JavascriptExecutor;

 

Java Code Snippets

  1. WebDriver temp = (JavascriptExecutor) driver;  
temp.executeScript(Script,Arguments);

     

  2. JavascriptExecutor temp = new (JavascriptExecutor) driver;  
temp.executeScript(Script,Arguments);

     

  3. JavascriptExecutor temp = (JavascriptExecutor) driver;  
temp.executeScript(Script,Arguments);

     

  4. WebDriver temp = new (JavascriptExecutor) driver;  
temp.executeScript(Script,Arguments);

Ben was working on Selenium WebDriver using Java. While he was working he faced some issues due to the cookies and he wanted to delete the browser cookies. If you are required to help Ben in this scenario then which of the following Java code snippets would you suggest Ben?

Java codes

  1. driver.Cookies.DeleteAllCookies();

     

  2. driver.Manage().DeleteCookie();

     

  3. driver.Manage().Cookies.DeleteCookies();

     

  4. driver.Manage().Cookies.DeleteAllCookies();

John was working on Selenium WebDriver using Java. Consider the following HTML code John was working on.

HTML Code

<input name="nameTemp" value="valueTemp">HackerEarth</input>

John wanted to get the attribute value using Selenium WebDriver. And he was coding in Java. Which of the following Java code snippets John has executed such that he received the following output:

Output

valueTemp

 

Java Code snippets

  1. String temp = driver.findElement(By.getAttribute("nameTemp","value"));
System.out.println(temp);

     

  2. String temp = driver.findElement(By.name("nameTemp")).getAttribute("value");
System.out.println(temp);

     

  3. String temp = driver.findElement(By.name("nameTemp")).getvalue("value");
System.out.println(temp);

     

  4. String temp = driver.findElement(By.name("nameTemp").getvalue("value"));
System.out.println(temp);

Paul was working on Selenium WebDriver using Java. Every day Paul log in to his college website and check the attendance. So he thought of automating this task so that he can save time. To login into the website, Paul needs to enter credentials i.e his username and password. But Paul always wanted to try something different.  So instead of using sendKeys() to enter values in the textbox, he wanted to use JavaScript. Paul has wrote the following 2 Java codes. In this scenario if you are required to help Paul then which of the following Java codes would you suggest:

Java code snippets

  1. JavascriptExecutor temp = (JavascriptExecutor)webdriver;

// To enter the username
temp.executeScript("document.getElementById('Username').value='HackerEarth.com'");

// To enter the password
temp.executeScript("document.getElementById('Password').value='Hack'");

     

  2. JavascriptExecutor temp = new (JavascriptExecutor)webdriver;

// To enter the username
temp.executeScript("document.getElementById('Username').value('HackerEarth.com')");

// To enter the password
temp.executeScript("document.getElementById('Password').value('Hack')");

a.option: I would suggest Paul that we cannot use Javascript to send values into the textbox.

q:
Bob was working on Selenium WebDriver using Java. While working there was a specific task to handle the SSL certificates using desired capabilities in the chrome browser. So Bob decided to create an instance of DesiredCpabilities. If you are required to help Bob in this scenario then which of the following Java syntaxes would you suggest to Bob?

Java Syntaxes

  1. DesiredCapabilities temp = SSLcertificateHandle.chrome();

     

  2. DesiredCapabilities temp = DesiredCapabilities.chrome();

     

  3. WebDriver temp = SSLcertificateHandle.chrome();

     

  4. WebDriver temp = DesiredCapabilities.chrome();

Alice was working on Selenium WebDriver using Java. Whenever she visits a website most of the websites ask for sending notifications. Alice always prefers to use chrome. So she always receives those chrome notifications asking for user permission. You can allow or block. Alice wanted to automate these notifications using selenium. So she implemented a code and it was successes. Considering this scenario which of the following Java code Alice might have used?

Java Codes

  1. ChromeNotifications temp1 = new ChromeNotifications();
temp1.addoptions("disable-infobars");
WebDriver temp2 = new ChromeDriver(temp1);

     

  2. ChromeNotifications temp1 = new ChromeNotifications();
temp1.addArguments("disable-infobars");
WebDriver temp2 = new ChromeDriver(temp1);

     

  3. ChromeOptions temp1 = new ChromeOptions();
temp1.addoptions("disable-infobars");
WebDriver temp2 = new ChromeDriver(temp1);

     

  4. ChromeOptions temp1 = new ChromeOptions();
temp1.addArguments("disable-infobars");
WebDriver temp2 = new ChromeDriver(temp1);

Lisa was working on Selenium WebDriver. She prepared few test cases to test whether the application behavior is working as expected or not. Over some research, she realized that Selenium Asserts are useful to validate whether the tests are passed or failed. So she has listed some Assertion types. Find out which of the following is not an assertion type?

Assertion types

  1. Assert
  2.  Verify
  3.  WaitFor
  4.  Wait

Anita was working on Selenium WebDriver. She wants to locate an element using the Class Name.
Consider the below HTML Code

<span>
<a class="temp practice" href="http://randomurl/" onclick="s_objectID="http://randomur/">url</a>
</span>

And she has executed the below Java code to find the element using the class name.

driver.findElement(By.className("temp practice")).click();

But the above code gave an error. Read the below statements and choose which of the following statements in this scenario are correct?

Statements

  1. The above code is showing an error because there was a space in the class name
  2. You can use the following code to resolve the issue. 
    driver.findElement(By.cssSelector("a[class='temp practice']")).click();

     

  3. You can use the following code to resolve the issue. 
    driver.findElement(By.xpath("//a[@class='temp practice']")).click();

John was working on Selenium Webdriver. He wants to find an element and take the data from it. So John was a little confused about the methods. So which of the following statements would you suggest john as correct?

Statements

  1. By just using id, class, or name we can identify any element uniquely.
  2. In case if elements are unable to identify using id, class, or name, we can identify using Xpath.
  3. If the elements are unable to identify using id, class, or name then we cannot identify even using Xpath.

Mike was on Selenium WebDriver to build a task. The task is to automatically connect with the user and collect their responses. When Mike deployed his program he found out that it was not waiting for the replies instead directly terminating the application and users data was not collected. So to solve this issue he found a simple solution, waiting until all the replies have been received. So to perform this operation he was using 2 commands.

Commands

  1.  waitForElementPresent
  2. pause

 

If you are required to map the below functionalities to the correct commands then which of the following option would you choose to opt as correct?

Functionalities
a. It pauses the execution process until it receives the specified element.
b. It pauses the execution process over a specified time period.

Mary was work on Selenium WebDriver. She was actually testing a website. She has listed some operations that she would like to perform whicle testing the website:

Operations 

  1. Defining style property of web page. 
  2. Evaluate or find an element on the page.
  3. Identifying nodes in XML Document.

 

She has these processes to perform the above operations.

 

Processes

a. DOM query
b. XPath query
c. CSS sector

 

Which of the following options map the processes with the correct operations?

Tara was working on a feature that reports the user when there was an alert. She was working on Selenium WebDriverand she had the following commands:

Commands

  1. verifyAlert
  2. assertAlert
  3. verifyAlertPresent
  4. assertAlertPresent

But she was confused about the functionalities of the commands. Please help her with this situation by mapping the correct definitions to the correct commands.

Definitions

a. It identifies when an alert occurs.

b. It verifies the alert text message in the alert popup window.

 

Which of the following options correctly maps the commands to its definitions.

 

Options

  1. 1, 2  -  a
3, 4  -  b

     

  2. 1, 2  -  b
3, 4  -  a

     

  3. 1, 3  -  a
2, 4  -  b

     

  4. 1, 3  -  b
2, 4  -  a

Paul was working on Selenium WebDriver to test a website. Paul was writing a script to automatically interact with the user to ask a question and take back the reply and update the database. But when he first wrote the script he found that the reply should be given immediately or else the task terminates. But the User may take a little time to think of a question. So he then decided to insert the feature for the script to wait for few seconds and then terminate if it was too late. So he wants to write a WAITFOR command. Which of the following statements about the WAITFOR command is True?

 

Statements

  1. The WAITFOR command pauses the execution for 30 seconds by default.
  2. The WAITFOR command does not have any default time period to pause the execution.
  3. By using the command setTimeout we can customize the time period to pause the execution.
  4. By using the command ExtendwaitFor we can customize the time period to pause the execution.

Ben was working on Selenium WebDriver. He wants to automate a task such that it should dynamically interact with the user. So he wants to get data from a specific element where the user may take some time to enter the data. Ben decided to use thread.sleep(). If you are required to help Ben then which of the following statements would you suggest?

 

Statements

  1. If the given wait time in thread.sleep() is 7 seconds and if the element loads after 4 seconds even then the execution still waits for 3 more seconds and then start executing.
  2. If the given wait time in thread.sleep() is 7 seconds and if the element loads after 4 seconds then the execution doesn't wait for 3 seconds and start executing immediately.
  3. It is always suggested to use implicit or explicit waits than thread.sleep().
  4. It is always suggested to use thread.sleep() than implicit or explicit waits.
In the automation framework, which of these is also known as Record & Playback?
